intro: Chingia christii, commonly known as the Christ's chingia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Chingia christii is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for its protection.
